pageContext.claim: “And with Bernie's, you know, they want to take the wealth that all of the people have made, 401(k)s you have 401(k)s, we all have 401(k)s and they're at record levels, they've done better than they've ever done, they want to just dissipate it.”
pageContext.analysis: This is not Bernie Sanders's plan. The senator has proposed an expansion of Social Security, not an end to 401(k) plans. The Sanders proposal includes higher base benefits and cost-of-living adjustments for Social Security recipients. His proposal would lift the current cap on payroll taxes, which is $132,900. Sanders would subject all income above $250,000 to the 12.4 percent Social Security payroll tax, among other measures.
